data.title: Pizza!
data.text:
In a hurry and want pizza, then you found the right place to go. It is fast and convenient yet good. The prices are really good too.
Gene P
Coplay, PA

data.title: Fast pizza
data.text: Mediocre pizza but fast take out service. Fast but pizza last time was not hot.  Slices not cut thouroughly thru the dough.

data.title: Hot n' Ready to flush down the toilet
data.text: Seriously, these heat lamp pies are nasty.  Why don't they bring back fresh to order pies?  No wonder there's barely any LC's around these days.  They use to be so good back in the 80's when they had the 2 pies on a board thing or whatever.

data.title: A SURE FIX FOR A QUICK DINNER
data.text: For lunch, dinner or a late night snack, nothing is as filling and easy to attain, than a quick stop at any Little Caesar's. Whether your on your way home from work, an outing of shopping or maybe some other late afternoon chore, Stopping at a Little Caesar's has been a life saver on more than one occasion. It's tasty, just the right thickness and consistency of dough and tomato sauce, and satisfies even the more hard to please patron. True, there at those brands that throw the kitchen sink onto a disc of dough and call it their own special names but call ahead, wait 15 to 30 minutes to pick up and pay double or triple what you would at any Little Caesar's. On eight out of ten times, you'll walk in, order, pay, pickup and be on your way home, to a party, or maybe just sitting in you car and enjoying it either alone or with friends. A good size tasty pie, along with an assortment of baked bread arrangements are available and it'll match any other pizza parlor dollar for dollar in town.
